snippet: Amaury and Amed Villa were accused of stealing $80 million worth of drugs at a warehouse in Connecticut in 2010, which the authorities said was the largest larceny of its kind in United States history.
abstract: Brothers Amaury and Amed Villa are accused of stealing $80 million worth of drugs from an Eli Lilly warehouse in Enfield, Connecticut in 2010 in what is being called the largest theft of prescription drugs in United States history.

byline.original: By PETER APPLEBOME and KRISTIN HUSSEY

lead_paragraph: Amaury and Amed Villa were accused of stealing $80 million worth of drugs at a warehouse in Connecticut in 2010, which the authorities said was the largest larceny of its kind in United States history.
